name: American Black Duck
description: Prefers coastal marshes and has declined due to habitat loss.

name: American Oystercatcher
description: Uses its strong orange bill to pry open mollusks.

name: Bald Eagle
description: Americaâ€™s national bird, once endangered, now thriving.

name: Black-crowned Night-Heron
description: Most active at night and dusk when hunting for fish.

name: Cerulean Warbler
description: A sky-blue warbler declining due to loss of mature forests.

name: Saltmarsh Sparrow
description: One of the only sparrows that nests exclusively in salt marshes.

name: Upland Sandpiper
description: A shorebird of the prairie with a distinctive wolf-whistle call.

name: Wood Thrush
description: Known for its hauntingly beautiful flute-like song.

name: Piping Plover
description: Tiny shorebird famous for its 'peep-lo' call.

name: Least Tern
description: The smallest American tern with a sharp, squeaky call.

name: Northern Harrier
description: Recognizable by its owl-like face and low, coursing flight.

name: Bobolink
description: Males sing bubbling songs as they flutter over grasslands.

name: Prairie Warbler
description: Prefers shrubby habitats and sings a rising buzzy song.

name: Eastern Meadowlark
description: Known for its cheerful, flute-like song and distinctive yellow belly.

name: Sedge Wren
description: A small wren that builds its nests in dense grass.

name: Great Egret
description: Known for its graceful flight and striking white plumage.

name: Northern Bobwhite
description: A ground-dwelling quail with a distinctive whistle.

name: American Woodcock
description: Known for its aerial display during the breeding season.

name: Marbled Godwit
description: A long-billed shorebird found in coastal mudflats.

name: Swainson's Hawk
description: A hawk known for its long migrations and large wingspan.

name: Eastern Whip-poor-will
description: Named for its distinctive 'whip-poor-will' call heard at night.

name: Ruby-throated Hummingbird
description: The only hummingbird species that breeds in eastern North America.

name: Black-billed Cuckoo
description: A bird known for its distinctive 'kow-kow-kow' call.

name: Scarlet Tanager
description: A striking red bird with black wings, found in deciduous forests.

name: White-eyed Vireo
description: A small songbird with a distinctive white ring around its eyes.

name: Common Nighthawk
description: A nocturnal bird that feeds on insects during its aerial flights.

name: Little Blue Heron
description: It looks much like a Snowy Egret when it is young, but molts to a dark slate-blue plumage as an adult.

name: Barn Owl
description: Recognized by its heart-shaped face and nocturnal hunting habits.

name: Grasshopper Sparrow
description: A small, brown sparrow that sings a short, insect-like trill.
